Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool.Turtle
  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    Mimic the Turtle graphics control language. This class is a facade for the Pen class.
    Author:
    readda

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean isPenDown
      Whether the pen is down such that the turtle should draw if it is moving
      private static org.apache.log4j.Logger LOG
      The logger
      private PenInterface pen
      The pen that is responsible for providing the graphics command support
      private int speed
      The turtle's drawing speed - 0 is fastest, 10 is moderately slow
      private static java.awt.image.BufferedImage turtle
      A buffered image containing the turtle image.
      private Image turtleImage
      The image for this Turtle instance
      private static int turtleImageHeight
      The height (in pixels) of the turtle image
      private static int turtleImageWidth
      The width (in pixels) of the turtle image
      private Text turtleLabel
      The label associated with the turtle image - this is optional and if null will not be displayed
      private boolean turtleVisible
      Whether the turtle image should be shown in the drawing surface

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(DrawingSurface drawingSurface)
        Create the Turtle context with pen down, black ink, and located in the center of the drawing surface. Initial forward direction is right (east).
        Parameters:
        drawingSurface - The drawing surface that the turtle will draw on

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(DrawingSurface drawingSurface,
              java.lang.String turtleName)
        Create and name the Turtle context with pen down, black ink, and located in the center of the drawing surface. Initial forward direction is right (east). The turtle's name will be used as a label for the Turtle. This can be helpful if you create more than one turtle.
        Parameters:
        drawingSurface - The drawing surface that the turtle will draw on
        turtleName - The name of the turtle

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initialize the environment

      • positionTurtle

        private void positionTurtle()
        Place the turtle at the current position, making it visible if it was hidden

      • positionTurtle

        private void positionTurtle​(boolean finalMove)
        Place the turtle at the current position, making it visible if it was hidden
        Parameters:
        finalMove - Pass true if the turtle has finished drawing a shape and its Z-order should be updated to assure it is on top of all other components of the drawing. Changing the Z-order has some overhead so it should not be done as each pixel of a long line is being drawn.

      • showTurtle

        public void showTurtle()
        Make the turtle visible

      • hideTurtle

        public void hideTurtle()
        Hide the turtle

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Lift the pen off of the drawing surface. The turtle will not draw when it is moved if the pen is up. Use penDown() to make the Turtle start drawing again.
        See Also:
        penDown(), forward(int)

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Place the pen on the drawing surface. The turtle will draw when it is moved if the pen is down. Use penUp() to make the Turtle stop drawing.
        See Also:
        penUp(), forward(int)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Delete the turtle's drawings, re-center the turtle and set variables to default values.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Delete the turtle's drawings. Do not move the turtle or change any settings.

      • speed

        public void speed​(int newSpeed)
        Set the turtle's speed with 0 meaning no animation (fastest). For non-zero values, 1 is very slow and 10 is very fast. The range of values is 0 to 10.
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - The turtle's speed with 0 meaning no animation (fastest).

      • forward

        public void forward​(int distance)
        Move the turtle forward. If the pen is down a line will be drawn. If the pen is up the turtle will move without drawing.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance the turtle should move (in pixels)

      • backward

        public void backward​(int distance)
        Move the turtle backward. If the pen is down a line will be drawn. If the pen is up the turtle will move without drawing.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance the turtle should move (in pixels)

      • right

        public void right​(int adjustAngleDegrees)
        Change the current direction of the turtle in a clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        adjustAngleDegrees - The number of degrees to turn the turtle. 90 is a sharp right turn, 180 would reverse direction and 360 would spin the turtle all the way around.

      • left

        public void left​(int adjustAngleDegrees)
        Change the current direction of the turtle in a counter-clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        adjustAngleDegrees - The number of degrees to turn the turtle. 90 is a sharp left turn, 180 would reverse direction and 360 would spin the turtle all the way around.

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading​(int angleDegrees)
        Set the current direction of the turtle to a specific heading. 0 is right (east), 90 is down (south), 180 is left (west) and 270 is up (north).
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - The angle which should be between 0 and 359, inclusive

      • color

        public void color​(java.awt.Color penColor)
        Set the drawing color of the pen used by the Turtle.
        Parameters:
        penColor - The color of the pen

      • color

        public void color​(double red,
                  double green,
                  double blue)
        Set the drawing color of the pen used by the turtle.
        Parameters:
        red - The red component (0-255)
        green - The green component (0-255)
        blue - The blue component (0-255)

      • color

        public void color​(int[] colors)
        Set the drawing color of the pen used by the turtle. The array should contain 3 values. The first for the red component, second for green, and the third for blue. Each should be in the range 0-255.
        Parameters:
        colors - The array of three colors values (RGB)

      • color

        public void color​(double[] colors)
        Set the drawing color of the pen used by the turtle. The array should contain 3 values. The first for the red component, second for green, and the third for blue. Each should be in the range 0-255.
        Parameters:
        colors - The array of three colors values (RGB)

      • write

        public void write​(int value)
        Write a number. The turtle will return to the start location after it is written
        Parameters:
        value - The number to write on the drawing surface

      • write

        public void write​(double value)
        Write a number. The turtle will return to the start location after it is written.
        Parameters:
        value - The number to write on the drawing surface

      • write

        public void write​(java.lang.String message)
        Write a message. The turtle will return to the start location after the message has been written.
        Parameters:
        message - The text to write on the drawing surface

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(int x,
                        int y)
        Pick the turtle up and place it down at a specific coordinate on the drawing surface. If the pen is down, a line is drawn from the original location to the new location.

        The upper left corner (origin) of the drawing surface is location (0, 0). The first number is the X coordinate, numbers larger than 0 will be to the left of the origin. The second number is the Y coordinate, numbers larger than 0 will be below the origin. Note that numbers less than 0 for either X or Y will set the turtle at locations not visible. They are to the right and above the origin respectively.

        Parameters:
        x - The X location (0 is the left edge of the drawing surface)
        y - The Y location (0 is the top edge of the drawing surface)
